ref: 7799s párābhavati ʻ perishes, yields ʼ AV., ʻ overcomes ʼ R., párābhāvayati ʻ overthrows ʼ AV. [√bhū]
Pa. parābhavati ʻ goes to ruin, wins through ʼ, parābhava -- m. ʻ defeat ʼ;
Pk. parābhavaï ʻ loses ʼ, parāhava<-> m. ʻ defeat ʼ;
Si. parayanavā (pret. päräyu) ʻ to conquer ʼ (SigGr ii 446 wrongly < parāji -- ).
